intro: Sida ononidifolia, commonly known as Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Sida ononidifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
